title: (x) Looking for a rounded sans for a kid's book - various {gang}
content:
Hi, I'm looking to find this typeface or something similar. I've illustrated a children's book and would like something like this for the title. If you know of other fonts for the body text that would work with this font I would appreciate the help. Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110401105602im_/http:/typophile.com/files/type_5038.jpg)
author: ER

comments.content:
Similar ones: VAG Rounded, Frankfurter, AG Rounded, Helvetica Rounded, [Bryant](http://web.archive.org/web/20110401105602/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/index.html), [Omnes](http://web.archive.org/www.joshuadarden.com/shop/omnes.php), [Gotham Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20110401105602/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gothamrounded/index.html).

Dav
Can we see some of your illustrations to give us a better look at what might work well?

There are seven pages of samples of 'Childish' typefaces, which range from kid-like scribbling to clean, simple lettering done by adults, in Part 12 of the [Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20110401105602/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script12Pg1.html). You can look up where any of them come from in the accompanying Script Font Reference List. Parts 5, 6 and 11 could also have more possibilities.

- Mike Yanega
Something rounded but designed for text: [FF Strada](http://web.archive.org/web/20110401105602/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_strada_text/)

Sassoon as well.

What the heck -- there's always Comic Sans Bold! ;-)

Hi, we went with the VAG rounded, many thanks for the help. I think the text goes well with the art now. I can't put the illustrations on the web until the publisher releases the book next Spring.

Thanks,

ER
